contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=January 2009}} {{Infobox royalty | monarch | name = Norodom Suramarit | title = [[King of Cambodia]] | image = Norodom Suramarit.jpg | reign = 3 March 1955 â€“ 3 April 1960 | coronation = | full name = Preach Reach Brhat Pada Samdach Brhat Naradhama Suramarta | predecessor = [[Norodom Sihanouk]] | successor = [[Norodom Sihanouk]] | spouse = [[Sisowath Kossamak]] | royal anthem = | father = [[Norodom Sutharot]] | mother = [[Norodom Phangangam]] | house = [[House of Norodom]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|1896|3|6|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Phnom Penh]], [[French Indochina]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1960|4|3|1896|3|6|df=y}} | death_place = [[Phnom Penh]], [[Cambodia]] | buried = | religion = [[Buddhism]] }} '''Norodom Suramarit''' (''Preah Karuna Preah Bat Samdach Preah Norodom Suramarit'') (6 March 1896 – 3 April 1960) was [[King of Cambodia]] from 1955 until his death. He was the father of King [[Norodom Sihanouk]] and the grandfather of Cambodia's current king, [[Norodom Sihamoni]]. Suramarit was born in [[Phnom Penh]]. He was the son of Prince Norodom Sutharot and grandson of King [[Norodom]]. Norodom Sihanouk was both Suramarit's predecessor and successor as the head of the state. Suramarit was a nephew of King [[Sisowath Monivong]]. Surmarit became Monivong's son-in-law when he married Monivong's daughter. Upon the Monivong's death in 1941, Sihanouk, Suramarit's son and Monivong's grandson, was selected as the new king. In 1955, Sihanouk abdicated in favor of his father. Following Suramarit's death in 1960, Norodom Sihanouk again became head of state (although he did not formally regain the title of king until after other periods in 1993). He was given the posthumous title of '''''Preah Karuna Preah Norodom Suramarit Preah Moha Kachanakkot'''''. King Norodom Suramarit was married to Queen [[Sisowath Kosamak]], daughter of King [[Sisowath Monivong]] who remained Queen Mother after her husband's death. [[Image:Norodom Suramarit and his wife.JPG|left|300px|thumb|Wax sculpture of King Suramarit and [[Sisowath Kossamak]].]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== {{S-start}} {{S-reg}} {{Succession box | before=[[Norodom Sihanouk]] | title=[[King of Cambodia]] | after=[[Norodom Sihanouk]] | years=1955-1960}} {{S-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Suramarit, Norodom | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Cambodian king | DATE OF BIRTH = 6 March 1896 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Phnom Penh]], [[Cambodia]] | DATE OF DEATH = 3 April 1960 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Phnom Penh]], [[Cambodia]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Suramarit, Norodom}} [[Category:Cambodian monarchs]] [[Category:1896 births|Norodom Suramarit]] [[Category:1960 deaths|Norodom Suramarit]] {{Cambodia-royal-stub}}
